10 photos show how drinking alcohol is changing people
06 Nov 2019, 17:15 by Daria Gromova
‚ÄúWhen I started, I just wanted to get my life back. But in the end, I got a new life filled with happiness, joy and freedom, which I did not even dream of. ‚Äù
Three years ago, American Kenny D. decided to change his life and stop drinking. In the process of his recovery, he regularly took photographs to see the result - and the difference turned out to be noticeable after a month. He told his story in an interview for Boredpanda.
The first photo he took was sober for 24 hours. He was broken by a hangover, his condition was terrible. For the first day without alcohol, he received his first medal from the society of anonymous alcoholics. Then he decided to take a selfie every time he received a new medal.


24 hours of sobriety

The second medal is the month of sobriety. Kenny says that at first, even family and friends did not believe in success - in the end, several years before that, he had behaved disgustingly. But his relatives still supported him - this, along with AA and a 12-step program for getting rid of addiction, helped him cope.


Sobriety month

In an interview, he said that at some point he was completely unable to control himself and ordered up to 20 drinks per evening. He drank 3-4 times a week until he turned off completely.


2 months of sobriety

He well remembered his last booze. He had a week-long vacation, so he bought a box of beer - at the rate of 3-4 bottles for the evening. On the very first evening he put his son in bed and opened the first beer, it was about 8 in the evening. At 11 pm, he opened 19 bottles - and realized that this could not continue any longer.


3 months of sobriety

The next morning, he turned to a friend who had previously quit drinking, and asked for help. Thus began his 12-step path to life without alcohol.


Six months of sobriety

‚ÄúGoing through these 12 steps was the hardest. I had to face the addiction and fix everything that I had done during the time I drank. When I started, I just wanted to get my life back. But in the end, I got a new life filled with happiness, joy and freedom, which I did not even dream of. ‚Äù


9 months of sobriety

‚ÄúMy life consists of rituals that help me to be better, to cope with anger and other negative emotions. Of course I'm not a saint, but I try to keep track of my emotions. If I feel that I can‚Äôt do it, I‚Äôll call relatives or friends from AA. ‚Äù


Year of sobriety

‚ÄúI can always get in touch with someone when I need it. Most of all I‚Äôm afraid to return to the previous state, so I try to load myself to the maximum: make appointments as many as possible, help those who have just started recovery. ‚Äù


1.5 years of sobriety

‚ÄúI began to read a lot, mostly documentary literature. I also started drawing - it opened up a potential in me that I had no idea about. ‚Äù


2 years of sobriety

During these three years, he lost 34 kilograms, began to eat right and do yoga. The result is obvious!
